summary: ENIAC, short for Electronic Numerical Integrator and Computer, was the first electronic computer that could be programmed to do different tasks. It was built in 1945 to help the U.S. Army with calculations for artillery. ENIAC was incredibly fast, working about 1,000 times quicker than earlier machines. It cost almost $487,000 to make and was later moved to Maryland, where it was used until 1955.
title: ENIAC
